title: Header Correction Task Status
details:
## Header Correction Task Status

**ISSUE IDENTIFIED:** The content generation logic in VaultIndexProcessor.cs is using hierarchy level instead of template type to determine section headers. This causes incorrect headers:

**Current State:**
- Main index (template-type: main) → "Programs" ✅ CORRECT
- Program index (template-type: program) → "Modules" ❌ should be "Courses"  
- Course index (template-type: course) → "Modules" ✅ CORRECT

**Required Mapping:**
- template-type: main → "Programs"
- template-type: program → "Courses" 
- template-type: course → "Modules" (unless Bases enabled, then suppress)
- template-type: class → "Modules"

**Root Cause:** Lines 441-509 in VaultIndexProcessor.cs use hierarchyLevel conditions instead of templateType to determine section headers.

**Fix Required:** Change content generation logic from hierarchy-level-based to template-type-based in the GenerateIndexContent method.

**Files Verified:**
- test-vault-structure/Projects/Projects.md (main) - Shows "Programs" ✅
- test-vault-structure/Projects/MBA/MBA.md (program) - Shows "Modules" ❌ 
- test-vault-structure/Projects/MBA/Digital Program/Digital Program.md (course) - Shows "Modules" ✅
